head.title: SONY SAYS CHIP WILL ADD BATTERY LIFE

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Technology, Telecommunications and Internet

hedline.hl1: SONY SAYS CHIP WILL ADD BATTERY LIFE

abstract.p: Sony is bringing out new version of its 2.2-pound Vaio C1VN PictureBook Computer using 600-megahertz microprocessor from Transmeta that will roughly double battery life of system, now ranging up to 5.5 hours (S)

block.p: Transmeta, the upstart chip maker, will announce its first major design victory today when Sony plans to bring out a new version of its 2.2-pound Vaio C1VN PictureBook Computer. The machine will use a 600-megahertz Transmeta microprocessor and will be priced at $2,299.99. Sony executives said the Transmeta chip would roughly double the battery life of the system, now ranging up to 5.5 hours. Earlier this year, Transmeta announced several Intel-compatible microprocessors designed to consume less power than comparable Intel chips. Since then, Intel has responded with its own low-power microprocessors.
